verses.roman:
āpani prabhuke lañā tāhāṅ uttaribā
rātri-dibā vetra-haste sevāya rahibā

synonyms: āpani—personally, yourself; prabhuke—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; lañā—taking; tāhāṅ uttaribā—you should go there; rātri-dibā—night and day; vetra-haste—with a cane in the hands; sevāya rahibā—should remain engaged in His service.
translation: "You should personally take the Lord to these newly constructed houses. Day and night you should engage in His service with a stick in your hands."
